section.title: Present Simple
section.sectiontitle: Use the Present Simple to talk about routines (things you do every day) and habits (things you do often). In the affirmative, add -s to the 3rd person (he/she/it).
section.text2a: She goes to bed about 11 o'clock.
section.sectiontitle2: For negatives, put don't or doesn't in front of the verb.
section.text4: He has a nap during the day.
section.text4a: He doesn't have a nap during the day.

section.title: Present Simple
section.sectiontitle: For questions and short answers, use do, does, don't or doesn't.
section.text1a: A: Do you get up early? B: Yes, I do.
section.text2a: A: Does he get up early? B: No, he doesn't.

section.title: Adverbs of frequency
section.sectiontitle: Use adverbs of frequency to say how often you do something.
section.text1a: I usually play the piano in the evenings.
section.sectiontitle2: The adverb of frequency comes after the verb to be. The adverb of frequency comes before a main verb.
section.text3a: I'm never late. (after the verb to be)
section.text4a: He sometimes goes clubbing on Saturdays. (before the main verb)
